statement: Jan 27-28 FOMC: Polymarket snapshot implies no-change as base case (combined 88.5% asof Jan 3).
market_link: Near-term policy odds are a key driver for front-end UST (ZT/ZF) and duration-sensitive equities (ES/NQ); shifts often move USD (DX) and EUR (6E).

statement: Fed calendar: Jan 28 decision 2:00pm ET; press conference 2:30pm ET (Jan 27-28 meeting).
market_link: Known timing tends to concentrate intraday volatility around statement/presser across ES/NQ and the Treasury complex; USD can react via real-rate moves.

statement: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs (Reuters).
market_link: Turn-of-year funding dynamics can affect front-end rate pricing and liquidity tone; key question is normalization in early January operations.

statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8 (9-mo low); Germany final 47.0 with export sales cited as a drag (Reuters).
market_link: EU growth softness can weigh global risk tone and support UST duration in risk-off tapes; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).

statement: FOMC member Paulson scheduled to speak Jan 3 and Jan 4 (local calendar); details not confirmed here.
market_link: Without topic text, risk is tape sensitivity in ZT/ZN and equity duration (ES/NQ) via reaction-function framing; USD (DX) can follow.

statement: Prior US cash close imbalances (Jan 2) were large on the buy side (local feed).
market_link: Closing-imbalance effects decay quickly; useful for contextualizing late-day ES/NQ volatility and next-session gap sensitivity.

statement: Baseline: CPI core y/y ~3.03% (Sep 2025) and PCE core y/y ~2.83% (Sep 2025) in local FRED snapshot.
market_link: Inflation baseline anchors real-rate sensitivity in ES/NQ and front-end UST (ZT) when new inflation prints shift the policy path.
